part.narration: Work is over. From her pocket, Yuki pulls the printed page in its creased and crumpled glory.Sudden cut to the practice hall.
Yuki stands at the corner near the entrance of the practice hall. On stage is Guest Chief Conductor Jacques Soleil Jr. and his orchestra. The mass of musicians play a song. They're all men!
JJ breaks his stick over the stand. He points his hand at every single member of the orchestra.
part.line: I didn't hire an all-male orchestra to play like a bunch of girls,
Nor did I hire you so that after work I could diddle your naughty bits!
Violin section, play like you have a pair.
That's why I got the hardest, best, and fastest, strongest players.
And coincidentally, none of you are women,
part.narration: Jacques spins to look behind him for a bit.

choice.narration: Yuki keeps her distance from the group. Hopefully, no-one sees her.
A cellist points behind JJ, off to the distance.
choice.line: And that's why you have to play well, bro!
No woman wants a man who sucks at his job.
Alas, A woman's will is man's last stand.
We are all missing that one warm, loving, caring woman.
choice.narration: The men tough it out and play harder.
Yuki stands directly behind JJ. This isn't the best place.
JJ sprints through the exit. Yuki picks up the half-stick.Get the Player to do this.
choice.line: Mr. Soleil is the pearl cast before us all.
You have a strong, courageous man fostering your talents.
And you're taking him for granted!
Play like you have a pair.
choice.narration: The men play like they have a pair. They play.

part.narration: The men play with twice the vigor; none of it becomes Yuki's.Zoom in on Yuki's face. Close-up sudden shift to The Clan.
